folder: Wall Street - Bank of Manhattan building (North)., Manhattan, NY
text:
40 Wall Street, north side, between William and Nassau Streets, showing the tower of the 70-story Bank of Manhattan Building as viewed southwestward from No. 1 Cedar Street.

July 7, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.
title: General view - [Manhattan - Wall Street - Bank of Manhattan building (North).]

folder: Wall Street - Bank of Manhattan building (North)., Manhattan, NY
text:
A general view northeastward from atop the Bank of Manhattan Building at No. 40 Wall Street, north side, west of William Street, showing tall modern structures forming the insurance unit of the financial zone. These are popularly known as the John Street buildings as they all front on that thoroughfare which runs between them. From left to right they are, the 25 story Insurance Center Building (No. 80 John Street); the 25 story National Board of Fire Underwriters Building (No. 99 John Street); the 28 story No. 90 John Street Building; the 26 story No. 111 and the 35 story No. 120 John Street Buildings. The latter is shown solely in View 2 opposite the New York Steam Company plant. In the background is the East River and its Brooklyn, Manhattan and Williamsburg Bridges.

March 9, 1933
View 2: March 24, 1933

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - [Manhattan - Wall Street - Bank of Manhattan building (North).]

text:
(1) A general view, northeast from 40 Wall Street, west of William Street, showing the tower of the Woolworth Building in the left foreground, (233 Broadway, between Barclay Street and Park Place. In the background is the Empire State, (Fifth Ave., and 34th St) and the Chrysler Buildings (Lexington Ave., and 42nd St). March 9, 1933. P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, as No. 1, showing a better view of a small portion of the Hudson River at the right, and the East River at the left. March 24, 1933. P. L. Sperr.

folder: Wall Street - Bank of Manhattan building (West)., Manhattan, NY
text:
A general view westward from the Bank of Manhattan Bldg. at No. 40 Wall Street, showing the "Vulcania on the North (Hudson) River between the upper portions of the Irving Trust Co. Bldg. and the Bankers Trust Co. Bldg. Both are on Wall Street, the first being at the S.E. corner of Broadway and the latter at the N.W. corner of Nassau Street. Note the Jersey Shore in the background.

March 24, 1933.
Views 1 and 2

P.L. Sperr
title: General view - [Manhattan - Wall Street - Bank of Manhattan building (West).]

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Wall Street - Bank of Manhattan building (Northwest)., Manhattan, NY
text:
A general view north westward from the Bank of Manhattan Bldg. at 40 Wall Street to show the "Vulcania" on the North (Hudson) River. The pyramid seen is atop the Bankers Trust Co. Bldg. which occupies the N.W. corner of Wall and Nassau Streets. To the right is the southerly side (Pine Street) of the 38 storied Equitable Bldg. occupying as it does an entire block from Nassau Street to Broadway and north to Cedar Street. In the distance appears the 28 story West Street Bldg facing the river.

March 24, 1933.
Views 1 and 2

P.L. Sperr
title: General view - [Manhattan - Wall Street - Bank of Manhattan building (Northwest).]

title: General view - [Manhattan - Wall Street - Bank of Manhattan building (Northwest).]

folder: Wall Street - Bank of Manhattan building (East)., Manhattan, NY
text:
A general view eastward from atop the Bank of Manhattan Building at No. 40 Wall Street, north side, west of William Street, to show the upper portions of several buildings of the financial district silhouetted against the East River and its piers. That, with the ornamentation is the Bank of New York and Trust Company Building. Beyond appears the irregular shaped Wall and Hanover (Brown Brothers) Building. To the right and overshadowing the others is the City Bank-Farmers Trust Company Building. Nestling in the hollow formed by these structures is the National City Bank. The tall smoke stack in the background is atop the new United States Assay Office on South Street at Old Slip. View No. 3 is southeastward towards Governors Island and shows the Coenties Slip vicinity overshadowed by the rear of the International Telephone Building, No. 67 Broad Street.

March 24, 1933
Views 1, 2 and 3

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - [Manhattan - Wall Street - Bank of Manhattan building (East).]

folder: Wall Street - Bank of Manhattan building (North)., Manhattan, NY
text:
A general view northward from atop the Bank of Manhattan Building at No. 40 Wall Street, north side, west of William Street, showing the adjacent civic area and lower East Side slums lying between the North (left of No. 1) and East (right of No. 2) Rivers. The tall structures seen are the Transportation, the Woolworth and the Municipal Buildings.

March 24, 1933
Views 1 and 2

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - [Manhattan - Wall Street - Bank of Manhattan building (North).]
